TULSA, Okla. (July 31, 2024) – Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa will welcome American Country Music Award nominee Connor Smith to the Track 5. stage at 9 p.m. on Saturday, Aug. 31. The live show is free to the public ages 21 and up.

At just 23 years old, Smith is one of country music’s most anticipated up-and-coming artists. In 2024, he was nominated among a prestigious group for New Male Artist of the Year. Smith is already a seasoned veteran of Nashville’s elite singer-songwriter community, having spent years matching a honeyed vocal with hints of bluegrass and rays of warmth from ‘90s country.

Smith has an uncommon talent for mixing his prime-of-life passion with an old soul perspective. This results in an artist who knows the past can still inspire the present. His sound takes from the molds of instant-classic country and infuses it with a riveting, modern appeal. Smith’s critically acclaimed debut album, “Smoky Mountains,” featured the gold-certified song “Take It Slow,” the viral hit “I Hate Alabama” and the UK chart-topper “Creek Will Rise.”

In addition to his ACM nod, Smith was named an Artist to Watch by Spotify, Amazon Music and Opry NextStage and earned acclaim as the only country artist on Pandora’s 2022 Ten List, recognition from 2023’s MusicRow Next Big Thing and the CRS New Faces Class of 2024. Smith is undoubtedly a rising star who will continue to delight and surprise fans with his music and high-energy, fan-forward shows. To learn more about Smith, visit connorsmithmusic.com.

Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa is the flagship property of Cherokee Nation Entertainment. From signature restaurants and gaming to award-winning live entertainment, Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa offers the best amenities in Oklahoma. Information on upcoming shows at Hard Rock Live, Track 5., Riff’s and Amp Bar is available online at www.hardrockcasinotulsa.com or by calling (918) 384-ROCK. The Hard Rock Live box office is open from 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Tuesday through Saturday.

CNE also operates Gold Strike Casino Resort in Tunica, Miss., one of the most recognizable gaming destinations in the region. For more information, visit www.HardRockCasinoTulsa.com, www.CherokeeCasino.com and www.GoldStrike.com.

About Hard Rock®:

Hard Rock International (HRI) is one of the most globally recognized companies with venues in over 70 countries spanning 309 locations that include owned/licensed or managed Hotels, Casinos, Rock Shops®, Live Performance Venues and Cafes. Its Unity by Hard Rock™ global loyalty program rewards members for doing the things they love across participating properties around the world. HRI also launched a joint venture named Hard Rock Digital in 2020, an online sportsbook, retail sportsbook and internet gaming platform. Beginning with an Eric Clapton guitar, Hard Rock owns the world's largest and most valuable collection of authentic music memorabilia at more than 88,000 pieces, which are displayed at its locations around the globe. Hard Rock Hotels has been honored by J.D. Power's North America Hotel Guest Satisfaction Study as the number one brand in Outstanding Guest Satisfaction for two consecutive years, and among the top Upper Upscale Hotels for four consecutive years. HRI became the first privately-owned gaming company designated a U.S. Best Managed Company by Deloitte Private and The Wall Street Journal in 2021 and has since been honored fourfold. Hard Rock was also honored by Forbes among the World's Best Employers, as well as Best Employers for Women, Diversity and New Grads and a Top Large Employer in the Travel & Leisure, Gaming and Entertainment Industry. In the 2022 Global Gaming Awards, Hard Rock was named Land-Based Operator of the Year for the second time in four years. Hard Rock International currently holds investment grades from primary investment-grade rating agencies: S&P Global Ratings (BBB) and Fitch Ratings (BBB). For more information on Hard Rock International, visit www.hardrock.com or shop.hardrock.com.

TULSA, Okla. (July 30, 2024) – Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa will welcome country music sensations Jamie O’Neal and Ty Herndon for “Merry Christmas, Baby,” a holiday spectacular concert, at 8 p.m. on Thursday, Dec. 5, at Hard Rock Live.

Tickets start at $19.50 and will go on sale Friday, Aug. 2.

“Merry Christmas, Baby” will feature a mix of classic holiday tunes and original songs, showcasing the artists’ unique interpretations and stunning harmonies. Attendees can expect an evening filled with warmth, nostalgia and the true spirit of the season.

Ty Herndon is a country music veteran with numerous hit singles, including “What Mattered Most,” “Living in a Moment,” and “It Must Be Love.” Herndon’s journey in the music industry began at the early age of 17 when he performed at Opryland USA. In 1995, his debut album, “What Mattered Most,” reached the top of the Billboard Hot Country Singles and Tracks chart.

Herndon has released multiple successful albums throughout his career and earned several industry awards and nominations. In 2020, Herndon found himself back at No. 1 – this time on iTunes with his remake of “Orphans of God,” a collaboration with Kristin Chenoweth and Paul Cardall featured on his holiday release, “Regifted.” “JACOB” is his first album of all new music since 2016’s “House on Fire.”

Joining Herndon is Jamie O’Neal, known for her powerful vocals and chart-topping hits like “There Is No Arizona” and “When I Think About Angels,” will bring her signature sound to the Hard Rock Live stage. Born in Australia to musician parents, O’Neal’s career skyrocketed after moving to Nashville and signing with Mercury Records. Her debut album, “Shiver,” earned her multiple Grammy nominations and showcased her songwriting prowess. O’Neal’s success continued with her second album, “Brave,” featuring the hit single “Trying to Find Atlantis.”

“Merry Christmas, Baby,” featuring Herndon and O’Neal, will be a show both Christmas enthusiasts and country music fans will not want to miss.

TULSA, Okla. (July 23, 2024) – Jefferson Starship, renowned as “the road-conquering heroes,” will ignite the stage, singing their epic catalog of rock classics at the Hard Rock Live stage inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Saturday, Nov. 23, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $29.50 and go on sale July 26.

Best known for their hit singles “Jane” and “Find Your Way Back,” the five-member band promises to deliver an electrifying set list of their greatest hits. With three platinum and eight gold records, Jefferson Starship has solidified their place in rock history with multiple Top 40 hits.

Founded in the 1970s by Paul Kantner and still anchored by original member David Freiberg, Jefferson Starship has evolved through the decades. Freiberg, legendary drummer Donny Baldwin, keyboardist Chris Smith, guitarist Jude Gold and vocalist/guitarist Cathy Richardson continue to carry Kantner’s musical legacy forward.

Celebrating their 50th anniversary, the band remains dedicated to delivering exceptional music and performances at the highest caliber.

For more information on Jefferson Starship, visit www.jeffersonstarship.com.

TULSA, Okla. (July 9, 2024) – Both known for musical dynamism that transcends generations, legendary artists Reverend Horton Heat and Jason D. Williams are joining forces for a powerhouse performance at Hard Rock Live inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Nov. 6 at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $19.50 and go on sale July 12.

Following their highly successful West Coast tour, the legends are uniting once more to bring their unforgettable performances to the Midwest. The duo is set to deliver an electrifying blend of rock ‘n’ roll, honky-tonk and boogie-woogie for a dynamic musical experience.

Texas-native Reverend Horton Heat has been a country-blues-rock mainstay for nearly 30 years with 10 full-length albums, three “best of” collections, two DVD releases and thousands of memorable live performances. The band is a regular of late-night television and has toured with legendary acts such as Johnny Cash, Motorhead, Marilyn Manson, The Ramones and many more, all of whom hold the Rev in the highest regard as a true music industry legend.

Jason D. Williams has spent a lifetime as a wild man onstage with influences like Jerry Lee Lewis, Moon Mullican and more. Behind the piano, he connects with country and rock ‘n’ roll greats while creating a persona that’s 100 percent original. Williams left his hometown of El Dorado, Arkansas, at the age of 16 and has since contributed to the rock history of Memphis and recorded for RCA and Sun Records in the 1980s and 1990s, and he returned to the recording fold in 2010. He also performed all of the hand shots of the movie “Great Balls of Fire,” among several other television appearances.

TULSA, Okla. (June 25, 2024) – A ‘90s country mainstay and one of the genre's most recognizable icons, Tracy Byrd is making his return to Hard Rock Live inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Thursday, Oct. 3 at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $24.50 and go on sale June 28.

Tracy Byrd rose to fame in 1993 after releasing his breakout hit “Holdin’ Heaven” from his certified gold debut album that reached No. 1 on the Billboard Country Charts. He quickly became a household name in the country music world with top-charting hits like “Watermelon Crawl,” “The First Step,” “The Keeper of the Stars” and “Heaven in My Woman’s Eyes.”

The traditional country troubadour is also known for his party and sing-along songs such as “The Drinkin’ Bone” and his third Billboard Charts No. 1 single “10 Rounds With Jose Cuervo.”

During his career, Byrd performed over 4,000 shows throughout many countries up until 2009. After taking a break from the stage, Byrd returned in 2016, releasing the album “All American Texan.”

TULSA, Okla. (June 18, 2024) – Hard Rock Hotel & Casino welcomes back legendary country artist Clint Black to the Hard Rock Live stage on Friday, Nov. 8, to celebrate the 35th anniversary of his debut album.

Tickets start at $59.50 and will be available June 21.

His first album, “Killin’ Time,” which kickstarted his stardom, will be performed from start to finish for the first time ever on his world tour. Originally released in 1989, the iconic album achieved five No. 1 singles on the Billboard Hot Country charts. Known as a true traditionalist, Black has been seamlessly blending traditional country, honky-tonk and Western swing for the last three decades.

Since his debut, Black has made a name for himself in country music as a singer, guitarist and songwriter with 22 No. 1 singles. His musical achievements have earned him a Grammy Award, nearly two dozen gold and platinum awards, and countless CMA, ACM and American Music Awards.

For more information on Clint Black, visit www.clintblack.com.

TULSA, Okla. (June 11, 2024) -- Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa will welcome Oklahoma Red Dirt pioneers The Great Divide at 8 p.m. on Friday, Sept. 13 at Hard Rock Live inside the casino.

Tickets start at $19.50 and go on sale June 14.

Known as one of the pioneers of Oklahoma's Red Dirt scene in the early 2000s. The Great Divide continues its much-awaited tour following a long hiatus after frontmen Mike McClure embarked on a solo career. Even after a long break, with many fans questioning the possibility of a reunion, The Great Divide continues to re-establish itself as the torchbearer of Red Dirt music.

The Great Divide marked their return to music with their first studio album in more than two decades, 2022's "Providence." The album includes the autobiographical track "Wrong is Overrated," which reflects on the band's split while keeping a forward-looking spirit. The album also includes the singles "Good Side" and "Infinite Line," which both topped the Texas music charts.

In 2023, since releasing their latest album, The Great Divide earned three Texas Country Music Awards, including Country Band of the Year. The group has also played sold-out homecoming shows at Tulsa's Cain's Ballroom, Stillwater's Tumbleweed Dance Hall and the legendary Greune Hall.

The impact of The Great Divide on the alternative country and Red Dirt genre cannot be overstated. The band has not only influenced legions of other artists, but many often classify Red Dirt into two distinct eras: pre- and post-Great Divide. Now, after 30 years as a band, with a new era in the works, it is certain that time will only continue to pave the way for the band to lay claim to its much-deserving place in history.

TULSA, Okla. (June 7, 2024) -- Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa will welcome iconic rock band TESLA to perform at 8 p.m. Nov. 13, 2024, at Hard Rock Live inside the casino.

Tickets will go on sale June 7, with prices beginning at $49.50.

TESLA is a celebration of the greatest spirits of rock 'n' roll. Their bluesy, soulful sound is deeply rooted in authentic 1970s rock 'n' roll. Born from the roots that produced bands like Aerosmith, AC/DC and Grand Funk Railroad, TESLA is known for hits such as "Love Song" and "Signs."

Beginning as City Kidd in 1984 in Sacramento, California, the band changed its name to TESLA, a nod to eccentric inventor Nikola Tesla who pioneered all things electrical. Their 1986 debut album, "Mechanical Resonance," went platinum with Top 40 hits "Modern DAy Cowboy" and "Little Suzi." "The Great Radio Controversy," their sophomore album, reached double-platinum status with hits like "Love Song" and "Heaven's Trail (No Way Out)." The success propelled the band, who had been touring with artists such as Def Leppard and David Lee Roth, into headlining status.

In 1990, TESLA released "Five Man Acoustical Jam," a pioneering rock album that mixed their hits with various covers, including "Signs," which became TESLA's biggest single. They followed up with more albums, including platinum-selling "Psychotic Supper" and "Bust a Nut." Today, TESLA continues to delight and electrify fans with their bluesy, energetic rock sound recording and selling out venues worldwide. For more information on TESLA, visit www.teslatheband.com.

TULSA, Okla. (June 7, 2024) – Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa will welcome Texas country artist Lane Smith to the Track 5. stage at 9 p.m. on Friday, July 26. The live show is free to the public ages 21 and up.

Lane's newly released single "Ran out of Road" blends a more expansive sound with catchy melodies and his own brand of country music, leaving his fans asking for more. Smith released his first EP in 2019 and has earned more than 2 million streams on all platforms. His first full-length album followed in June 2023. Smith's singles to be on the lookout for include "Red Lights," "Austin" and "Big Show."

Raised in the heart of Texas Hill Country in Spring Branch, Smith is no stranger to country music. Before releasing his first songs, Smith made his rounds through the rodeo circuit as a bullfighter, a culture heavily influencing country music. After a chorus of friends encouraged Smith to play his music, he embarked on a journey not too far off from rodeo life -- being out on the road -- but this time singing country music. Today, Smith has already played at legendary venues, including the historic Gruene Hall, and has served as a supporting artist alongside other artists such as Colt Ford, Chase Matthews, Matt Stell and Kyle Park.

For more information on Lane Smith, visit www.lanesmithmusic.com.

TULSA, Okla. (June 3, 2024) -- Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa will welcome Texas country artist Grant Gilbert to the Track 5. stage at 9 p.m. on Friday, June 21.

The live show is free to the public ages 21 and up.

Gilbert's performance follows the much-anticipated release of his newest single, "Drunk Since Dallas," his second-single in 2024 after the release of "Turn It Down," featuring Ashland Craft. Gilbert's popularity continued to grow since his 2023 album, "Between the Highways," which featured his first No. 1 Texas Regional Radio Chart single, "Six Pack State of Mind," featuring Josh Abbott.

From Santo, Texas, Gilbert grew up on a cattle ranch listening to Texas country greats such as Pat Green, Randy Rogers Band and other red dirt artists like Stoney LaRue. Gilbert was also influenced by everything from his grandparents' swing and fiddle tunes to his dad's affinity for Springsteen, Tom Petty and 1980s country. While cut from Texas country cloth, Gilbert's music reflects a stryle of his own design, merging rock and country with catchy melodies. Also, reflecting his roots, Gilbert's music offers a fresh perspective on songwriting that centers on small-town storytelling.

Gilbert first became involved in Lubbock's vibrant country music scene while a student at Texas Tech University. Following college, he began working in Nashville as a songwriter, collaborating with hit writers like Brad Clawson, Jessie Jo Dillon and Dan Isbell while recording with producer and songwriter Jonathan Singleton. His tracks "She Goes Home (Dirty Breakup Song)," "God & Everybody" and "What's Stopping Us" have racked up over 3 million streams to date on Spotify alone.

For more information on Grant Gilbert, visit www.grantgilbertmusic.com.

TULSA, Okla. (May 28, 2024) – With a career that’s lasted more than 40 years, country legend John Anderson is making his acoustic return to Hard Rock Live inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Thursday, Sept. 12, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $29.50 and go on sale May 31.

John Anderson grew up in Apopka, Florida. He started his music career performing solo around the state while working construction before moving to work on the roofing crew for the new Grand Ole Opry House. That’s where he landed a recording contract.

After charting modestly in the late ‘70s, Anderson scored No. 1 hits in the ‘80s with “Wild and Blue,” “Swingin’” and “Black Sheep.” After a brief career lull, he staged a major comeback in 1992 as “Starlight Tequila Night” became his first No. 1 single in nine years. That momentum carried him into the 2000s, giving him 60 charting country singles in four consecutive decades.

For more information on Anderson, visit www.JohnAnderson.com.

TULSA, Okla. (May 21, 2024) – NFL Hall of Famer, four-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback and preeminent TV personality Terry Bradshaw will bring his show, full of laughter, football wisdom and memorable moments, to Hard Rock Live inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Friday, July 26, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $39.50 and go on sale May 24.

Terry Bradshaw is a larger-than-life personality known for his energy, zeal and enthusiasm on and off the field. The first player chosen in the 1970 draft, the 6’3” Bradshaw became one of the most prolific quarterbacks in history. He was the first quarterback to win four Super Bowls (1975, 1976, 1979 and 1980), making him a perfect 4-0 in Super Bowl play. A two-time Super Bowl MVP and a four-time All-Pro, he retired before the 1984 season.

Bradshaw segued to broadcasting as a guest commentator for CBS Sports in 1980 before transitioning to an NFL game analyst in 1984 and then became a studio analyst on “The NFL Today” for four seasons in 1990. He later made his mark in TV as co-host and analyst on “Fox NFL Sunday,” which earned him Sports Emmy Awards in the Outstanding Sports Personality/Analyst category in 1999, 2001 and 2009, and he was named TV Guide's favorite sportscaster in 1999. Bradshaw was inducted into the Sports Broadcasting Hall of Fame in December 2022.

Bradshaw has also become a household name by appearing in several feature films like “Failure to Launch,” and lending his voice to the animated film “Robots.” His television credits also include guest roles on “Everybody Loves Raymond,” “8 Simple Rules,” “Malcolm in the Middle,” “Evening Shade,” “Blossom” and more. Bradshaw also hosted his talk show, "The Home Team with Bradshaw Bradshaw," the first talk show ever to debut simultaneously on network and syndicated television. He also authored five books and recorded four successful gospel records that were nominated for Dove Awards.

Bradshaw spends his time at his home in Texas with his wife, Tammy, and has three daughters: Rachel, Erin and Lacey, and three grandchildren: Zurie, Jeb and Jessie.

TULSA, Okla. (May 20, 2024) -- Country music up-and-comer Pryor Baird is hitting the stage at Track 5., located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa, on Saturday, June 8, at 9 p.m.

The show is free to the public ages 21 and up.

Baird has emerged as a powerhouse in the country music scene. From mastering the guitar at a young age to captivating audiences on NBC’s “The Voice,’ Baird’s journey is one of relentless passion and talent. Recently making his Grand Ole Opry debut, Baird continues to solidify his authority as a guitar-wielding, country-rock artist.

Baird’s latest release, “Mighta Met a Girl,” co-written with Chris Gelbuda and David Toliver and produced by Doug Johnson, showcases his soulful country-rock sound. This track follows his debut single, “You Are To Me,” which has garnered over 300,000 streams since its release. Both songs have earned spots on top playlists, including Spotify’s New Music Friday Country and Apple Music’s New in Country, establishing Baird as a rising star to watch.

Having embarked on a 12-city trek with hitmaker David Nail, Baird has captivated audiences nationwide with his electrifying performances. Hailing from Orcutt, California, Baird’s future in the industry looks brighter than ever.

For more information on Pryor Baird, visit https://pryorbaird.com.

TULSA, Okla. (May 14, 2024) – Hailing from New York, progressive rockers Coheed and Cambria will bring their collection of hits to Hard Rock Live inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Thursday, Sept. 5 at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $39.50 and go on sale May 17.

For the last 20 years, Coheed and Cambria have continuously broken the mold of what a rock band can be, forging their path and building a universe around their music unlike any other. In 2018, the band made their debut with their album “Vaxis I: The Unheavenly Creatures,” which debuted at No. 1 on Billboard’s “Hard Rock Albums” chart, No. 6 current sales and Top 15 on the “Billboard 200” chart. With cult favorite hits like “Welcome Home,” “Shoulders,” “A Favor House Atlantic,” “The Suffering” and more, the band has consistently shaped new standards since then in the rock genre.

Today, Coheed and Cambria continue to bridge worlds within the genre through their unique style of songwriting and building multifaceted story arcs of their albums and comic book series. Comprised of Claudio Sanchez on vocals and guitar, Travis Stever on guitar, Josh Eppard on drums and Zach Cooper on bass, the band is known for their visionary compositions and conceptual mastery.

For more information on Coheed and Cambria, visit www.coheedandcambria.com.

TULSA, Okla. (April 16, 2024) -- Dirty Honey is bringing in a new age of rock to Hard Rock Live, located inside Hard Rock Hotel and Casino Tulsa, on Saturday, July 20, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $24.50 and go on sale April 19.

With their self-titled extended play released in March 2019, Dirty Honey catapulted to the top of the charts with their hit single “When I’m Gone,” becoming the first unsigned band to dominate the Billboard Mainstream Rock Songs chart. Their unparalleled success caught the attention of iHeartRadio, earning them the prestigious title of iHeartRadio On the Verge Artist.

The beginning of Dirty Honey traces back to guitarist John Notto’s encounter with the vocalist Marc Labelle in the vibrant music scene of Los Angeles. What started as a collaboration between like-minded musicians quickly evolved into a powerhouse quartet with the addition of bassist Justin Smolian and drummer Corey Coverstone.

Inspired by the raw energy of rock legends like Guns N’ Roses, Dirty Honey emerged with a sound that pays homage to the classic rock era while infusing their unique modern flair. Fueled by their passion for music and driven by their relentless work ethic, Dirty Honey’s journey to stardom has been nothing short of remarkable.

From their impromptu sidewalk performance on Sunset Boulevard to sharing the stage with icons like Slash and The Who, the band’s sudden rise has captivated audiences worldwide. Their debut album, released amidst the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, further solidified their place in rock history, garnering critical acclaim and accolades from industry veterans. As they continue to push boundaries and redefine the rock genre, Dirty Honey shows no signs of slowing down.

For more information on Dirty Honey, visit https://www.dirtyhoney.com.

TULSA, Okla. (April 8, 2024) -- Jamey Johnson is taking the stage at Hard Rock Live, located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino, on Saturday, Sept. 28, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $69.50 and go on sale April 19.

Acclaimed singer-songwriter Jamey Johnson, hailing from Enterprise, Alabama, has carved an indelible mark in the realm of country music with an unwavering dedication to his craft and unmatched resilience. Rising from humble beginnings, Johnson’s journey epitomizes the quintessential American dream, embodying the spirit of perseverance and passion.

A veteran of the United States Marine Corps, Johnson’s musical roots run deep, shaped by legendary sounds of his home state icons like Hank Williams and Vern Gosdin. Johnson honed his skills as a songwriter, eventually gaining recognition for his contributions to the industry. Johnson’s breakout moment came with the release of his critically acclaimed albums, earning him a slew of awards and nominations. Tracks like “In Color,” “The Dollar” and “High Cost of Living” have resonated deeply with audiences, solidifying Johnson’s status as a torchbearer of traditional country music.

With a style reminiscent of Waylon Jennings and Hank Williams, Johnson’s authenticity shines through in every performance, captivating audiences worldwide. Continuing his upward trajectory, Johnson’s latest endeavors include the release of “Living for Song: A Tribute to Hank Cochran,” a testament to his reverence for the genre’s pioneers.

Fore more information on Jamey Johnson, visit www.jameyjohnson.com.

TULSA, Okla. (April 9, 2024) -- Known for his storytelling of heartaches and triumphs, legendary country artist Doug Stone is set to take the stage at Hard Rock Live, located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa, on Wednesday, Aug. 21, at 8 p.m.

Tickets are $15 and go on sale April 12.

With hits like “A Jukebox and a Country Song” and “Too Busy Being in Love,” Stone dominated the country music scene throughout the 1990s. Despite health setbacks, including quadruple bypass surgery, Stone’s determination never wavered. His resilience extended beyond music, as he ventured into acting with roles in films like “Gordy” and “When the Storm God Rides.”

Stone’s talent and resilience culminated in a partnership with Epic Records in his thirties, leading to the release of his self-titled debut album in 1990. His debut album skyrocketed with chart-topping singles like “I’d Be Better Off (In a Pine Box)” and “In a Different Light,” earning him critical acclaim and a Grammy Award nomination. His subsequent albums, including “From the Heart” and “More Love,” solidified his status as a country music icon, with multiple platinum and gold certifications.

Now after over three decades in the industry, Stone continues to captivate audiences nationwide with his timeless hits and newfound sobriety. Stone remains a beacon of pure country talent and inspiration after his latest acoustic release in 2022.

TULSA, Okla. (April 2, 2024) -- Rick Springfield and Richard Marx are uniting for an acoustic show at Hard Rock Live, located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa, on Friday, Aug. 23, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $59.50 and go on sale April 5.

Rick Springfield, a Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter and accomplished actor, has left a permanent mark on the music industry with his dynamic performances and chart-topping hits. From the iconic “Jessie’s Girl” to the touching “An Affair of the Heart,” Springfield’s contributions to the realm of pop have earned him widespread acclaim. Beyond music, his versatile talents have graced the silver screen and television, showcasing his vast array of abilities in acclaimed productions such as HBO’s “True Detective” and FX’s “American Horror Story.”

Celebrating 35 years as a recording artist and prolific songwriter, Richard Marx joins Springfield as he commands attention with his timeless melodies and powerful lyrics. With a diverse catalog spanning multiple genres, Marx has earned a reputation for crafting unforgettable compositions that resonate with audiences worldwide. From the chart-topping ballad “Right Here Waiting” to the anthemic “Satisfied,” his enduring impact on the music landscape is undeniable.

Together, Springfield and Marx offer a rare opportunity for audiences to experience the magic of live music in its purest form. Their acoustic showcase promises an intimate journey through decades of musical excellence, punctuated by heartfelt storytelling and unforgettable performances.

TULSA, Okla. (March 26, 2024) -- Josh Turner, known for his deep baritone vocals, is making his way to Tulsa for a performance at Hard Rock Live, located inside Hard Rock Hotel and Casino, on Thursday, Aug. 15, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $39.50 and go on sale March 29.

With chart-topping hits like “Long Black Train” and “Why Don’t We Just Dance,” Josh Turner has solidified his status as a musical icon, amassing an impressive 5.8 billion streams and achieving 6.5 million album sales alongside nearly 12 million track sales worldwide. Notable among his achievements are five No. 1 singles, including the beloved anthem “Your Man,” which has garnered over 223 million views on its official music video.

In a career spanning two decades, Turner’s debut album, “Long Black Train,” was certified platinum by the RIAA, boasting over 1.5 million album sales and 1. 3 million track downloads. Celebrating 15 years of his acclaimed album “Your Man,” Turner released the deluxe edition, featuring the viral sensation “Would You Go With Me,” which surged in popularity on TikTok and earned recognition on Spotify’s US Viral 50 and international viral charts.

Beyond the stage, Turner remains dedicated to supporting arts education exemplified by initiatives like The Josh Turner Scholarship Fund for the Arts. Together with his wife, Jennifer, Turner’s unwavering commitment to family and music continues to inspire audiences worldwide.

For more information on Josh Turner, visit https://joshturner.com.

TULSA, Okla. (March 22, 2024) – Trea Landon is heading to Tulsa to take the stage at Track 5., located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa, on Saturday, April 27, at 9 p.m.

The show is free to the public ages 21 and up.

Hailing from Daisy, Georgia, Landon’s upbringing instilled in him a genuine connection to the rural lifestyle, reflected in his music. Balancing his life between the stage and the countryside, Landon seamlessly translates his firsthand experiences into songs that resonate with audiences, encapsulating themes of love, heartbreak and the essence of rural living.

Influenced by fellow Georgia natives, The Peach Pickers, Landon’s journey to Nashville in 2015 quickly led to a publishing deal within a mere four weeks of his arrival. The swift path led to a major label contract with Warner Music Nashville just two years later. Since then, Landon has garnered acclaim for his EP releases and a series of classic cover renditions, solidifying his place as a rising star in the country music scene.

Among Landon’s most popular tracks are “Loved by a Country Boy,” “Dirt Road Dancin’,” and “Ain’t Got Nothing on You,” each showcasing his ability to craft relatable lyrics and memorable melodies that resonate with fans across the nation. Already having shared the stage with industry heavyweights such as Luke Combs, Cole Swindell and Riley Green, Landon continues to captivate audiences with his authentic storytelling and charming performances.

TULSA, Okla. (March 19, 2024) -- Renowned hip-hop sensation Chingy and Grammy-nominated artist Petey Pablo take the stage for the “Right Hurr/Right Thurr” Tour at Hard Rock Live, located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa, on Saturday, July 13, at 8 p.m.

Tickets start at $29.50 and go on sale March 22.

Chingy, an accomplished actor and philanthropist, skyrocketed to superstardom with the triple-platinum, RIAA-certified debut album “Jackpot,” featuring chart-topping hits like “Right Thurr” and “Holidae In.” His second platinum album, “Powerballin’,” showcased the Hot 100 hit “Balla Baby” and a collaboration with Janet Jackson on “Don’t Worry.”

Chingy’s success continued with gold record “Hoodstar,” producing chart-toppers like “Pullin’ Me Back” and “Dem Jeans.” Collaborating with industry icons like R. Kelly, Bun B, Lil Wayne and more, Chingy’s influence transcends genres.

Joining forces with Chingy is the versatile rapper Petey Pablo, a “Dirty South” hip-hop icon. Known for anthems like “Raise Up,” “Freek-A-Leek” and “Carolina Colors.” His chart-topping hit “Raise Up” peaked at No. 1 on the US Billboard Rap Chart. Collaborating with the likes of Ciara, Timbaland, Chris Brown and Lil Wayne, Pablo’s influence extends far beyond his solo career. Pablo’s Grammy-nominated debut album, “Diary of a Sinner: 1st Entry,” and “Still Writing in My Diary: 2nd Entry” showcase his diverse talent.

Chingy and Petey Pablo’s collaboration promises to bring together two iconic forces in the hip-hop world, creating a blend of talent that resonates with audiences worldwide.

Chayce Beckham, an “American Idol” sensation, is set to take the stage at Track 5. located inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tulsa on Thursday, April 4, at 8 p.m.

Beckham has swiftly risen to fame in the country music scene. Following his victory on the 19th season of “American Idol” in 2021, Beckham released his debut EP, “Doin’ It Right,” which quickly climbed to No. 1 on both iTunes All Genre and Country charts. As Beckham continues to build on his success, he recently concluded tours with Jimmie Allen and Luke Combs in 2022 and Luke Bryan’s 2023 “Country On” tour. With a rapidly growing fanbase and chart-topping singles, Beckham’s journey from a blue-collar troubadour to a rising star in the music industry is a testament to his resilience and undeniable talent.
